candidates.title: slh-dsa: bump `zerocopy` to v0.8
candidates.body:
The `AsBytes` trait is gone, and now found on the `IntoBytes` trait.

It needs a new `Immutable` marker trait which says:

> Types which are free from interior mutability.

...so it seems safe to add to the types that previously used `AsBytes` which are simple data structs.

candidates.title: Bump `hybrid-array` to v0.4
candidates.body:
Currently getting a test failure(!) in `dsa`, possibly related to `crypto-bigint` changes?

```
---- verify_signature stdout ----

thread 'verify_signature' panicked at dsa/tests/signature.rs:91:5:
assertion failed: verifying_key.verify_digest(Sha256::new().chain_update(MESSAGE),
        &signature).is_ok()
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

---- sign_message stdout ----

thread 'sign_message' panicked at dsa/tests/signature.rs:80:5:
assertion `left == right` failed
  left: Signature { r: NonZero(BoxedUint(0x00000000C6639F3AC90E4AAE648FB30C885F96A0C5E32D09)), s: NonZero(BoxedUint(0x00000000BFF0252CE80AC9281C12395433CA2FEC8A0DAAFF)) }
 right: Signature { r: NonZero(BoxedUint(0x000000004E12277518F640E33ADB806DE798D3A340F59D0F)), s: NonZero(BoxedUint(0x0000000017781EC8535891E03F2D3627366BAC8ED7F9A4CF)) }
```

Edit: confirm this test failure appears when updating `crypto-bigint` alone, going to bisect the changes.

Edit again: bisected to https://github.com/RustCrypto/crypto-bigint/pull/920

candidates.title: ecdsa: use new `Reduce` trait
candidates.body: Uses the `Reduce` trait added in RustCrypto/traits#1949

candidates.title: ecdsa: adopt `der` API changes
candidates.body:
Make ecdsa crate compatible with API changes made to `Header` struct in the `der` crate.

Followup to https://github.com/RustCrypto/formats/pull/1931

candidates.title: ecdsa v0.17.0-rc.5
candidates.body: Closes #1018

candidates.title: dsa: make `pkcs8` feature optional
candidates.body:
It's not needed in applications which define their own key encodings, for example SSH.

The feature is still enabled by-default.

candidates.body: Companion PR to RustCrypto/formats#1889

candidates.title: dsa v0.7.0-rc.1
candidates.body: Includes `crypto-bigint` v0.7.0-pre.5 upgrade

candidates.title: ecdsa: bump `der` to v0.8.0-rc.5
candidates.body:
This version notably automatically handles setting up a nested `Reader` for passing to `DecodeValue::decode_value`, eliminating the need to do it manually.

Also cuts an `ecdsa` v0.17.0-rc.3

candidates.title: dsa: handle `NonZero`/`Odd` conversions on `BoxedUint` internally
candidates.body:
Makes `BoxedUint` the one unsigned integer type in the public API, converting to `NonZero<BoxedUint>` and `Odd<BoxedUint>` as needed.

This makes the API simpler to use for end-users, with fewer types for them to manage.

Closes #987

candidates.title: Cargo.lock: bump `bumpalo` to v3.18.1
candidates.body: Fixes security audit

candidates.title: ed448: drop `-signature` suffix from crate name
candidates.body:
Crate name is now just `ed448`, like the Ed448 variant of EdDSA.

The elliptic curve's name is Ed448-Goldilocks (or "edwards448")

candidates.title: ml-dsa: Turn off unsused default features so that no_std works
ed25519,ed448: remove std features
candidates.body: followup to #984

candidates.title: Implement `MultipartSigner/Verifier`
candidates.body:
Implementation of `MultipartSigner` and `MultipartVerifier` added in https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1880.

The implementation in ML-DSA and SLH-DSA is not ideal. Basically all the relevant functions are public and only take `&[u8]`. So instead of changing public functions, I just moved the implementation of those functions into private functions that take `&[&[u8]]`. Let me know if you want me to solve this in any other way.

candidates.title: dsa: remove `std` feature
candidates.body: It isn't actually used for anything, and with a hard dependency on `alloc` and `core::error::Error` we can always capture `Box<std::error::Error>` in `signature::Error`.

candidates.title: dsa: minor `hazmat` cleanups
candidates.body:
- Place attributes after comments
- Ensure `hazmat` features are documented on docs.rs

candidates.title: Bump `digest` dependency to v0.11.0-rc.0
candidates.body:
Also bumps:

- `signature` v3.0.0-rc.0

candidates.title: Revert "ecdsa: use blanket impl from `signature` 3 (#945)"
candidates.body: This reverts commit 8e6bb26c26ed511fda6e792a12df9c43f07370e9.

candidates.title: Implement `Zeroize` for `ecdsa::Signature`
candidates.body: This PR implements `Zeroize` for `ecdsa::Signature` by setting both scalars to one, which is still a valid signature and upholds the types invariants.

candidates.title: signature does not carry the `std` feature anymore
candidates.body: follow up to #945

candidates.title: ecdsa: use blanket impl from `signature` 3

This is stacked on #944 

This makes use of https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1827

candidates.body: Closes #937

candidates.title: Revert "downgrade ml-dsa and slh-dsa to non-prerelease deps"
candidates.body:
This reverts commit 64b55c6393736de5a89b9b4c64f013d680945eef from #931

This was done to kick out some releases, which have now been published, so these crates are going back to using the latest development releases.

chosen_pr.title: slh-dsa: bump `zerocopy` to v0.8
chosen_pr.body:
The `AsBytes` trait is gone, and now found on the `IntoBytes` trait.

It needs a new `Immutable` marker trait which says:

> Types which are free from interior mutability.

...so it seems safe to add to the types that previously used `AsBytes` which are simple data structs.

chosen_detail.title: slh-dsa: bump `zerocopy` to v0.8
chosen_detail.body:
The `AsBytes` trait is gone, and now found on the `IntoBytes` trait.

It needs a new `Immutable` marker trait which says:

> Types which are free from interior mutability.

...so it seems safe to add to the types that previously used `AsBytes` which are simple data structs.
